title: White Sox broadcaster Hawk Harrelson takes on extremely reduced role
text:
News broke Monday that longtime White Sox TV broadcaster Ken “Hawk” Harrelson will broadcast only 81 games next season.
The story was first reported by Bruce Levine on 670 The Score’s Spiegel and Goff Show.
. @MLBBruceLevine breaking news on our show. Hawk Harrelson will only call 78 road games, opening day and 2 Cubs games at US Cell next year.
— Spiegel & Goff (@SpiegelAndGoff) October 5, 2015
The change was attributed to Harrelson’s desire to stop commuting to Chicago from his home in South Bend, IN. for every game. The three games Harrelson will still broadcast from Chicago will likely be three of the most watched home games of the season.
There were no details given on what Harrelson’s role would be if the White Sox were to reach the playoffs.
Sunday night’s White Sox game concluded the 31st season Harrelson has broadcasted for the team. Throughout his time in Chicago, Harrelson has been recognized both locally and nationally for his work.
